had not seen fit to recognize him. But now that Kutuzov had spoken to the gentleman ranker, he addressed him with the cordiality of an old friend. 
"My dear fellow, how are you?" said he through the singing, making his horse keep pace with the company. 
"How am I?" D61okhov answered coldly. "I am as you see." 
The lively song gave a special flavor to the tone of free and easv gaiety with which Zher- k6v spoke, and to the intentional coldness of D61okhov's reply.
